title: Decision Point schema definition
description: Decision points are the basic building blocks of SSVC decision functions. Individual decision points describe a single aspect of the input to a decision function.

schemaVersion.description: Schema version used to represent this Decision Point.

key.description: A short, unique string (or key) used as a shorthand identifier for a Decision Point Value.

name.description: A short label that identifies a Decision Point Value

description.description: A full description of the Decision Point Value.
examples: One of the following is true: (1) Typical public PoC exists in sources such as Metasploit or websites like ExploitDB; or (2) the vulnerability has a well-known method of exploitation.
Attackers can reliably automate steps 1-4 of the kill chain.

namespace.description: Namespace (a short, unique string): The value must be one of the official namespaces, currenlty "ssvc", "cvss" OR can start with 'x_' for private namespaces. See SSVC Documentation for details.

version.description: Version (a semantic version string) that identifies the version of a Decision Point.

key.description: A short, unique string (or key) used as a shorthand identifier for a Decision Point.

name.description: A short label that identifies a Decision Point.

description.description: A full description of the Decision Point, explaining what it represents and how it is used in SSVC.

values.description: A set of possible answers for a given Decision Point
